meanings.definition: A type of lens used in photography that corrects for distortion and aberrations.
meanings.sent1: Photographers often rely on anastigmats to capture clear and sharp images.
meanings.sent2: The new camera lens is equipped with anastigmats for better picture quality.
meanings.sent3: When the anastigmats in the lens went on strike, the photos turned out blurry.
meanings.sent4: Her vision through the anastigmats of the camera was like seeing the world in high definition.
meanings.sent5: The anastigmats in the lens acted like tiny detectives, uncovering every detail in the scene.

meanings.sent1: Optical engineers carefully selected anastigmats to enhance the performance of the telescope.
meanings.sent2: The binoculars were designed with an array of anastigmats for a wider field of view.

meanings.definition: To describe a camera or optical device that uses anastigmats for improved image quality.
meanings.sent1: Photographers anastigmat their equipment to ensure top-notch photos.
meanings.sent2: He anastigmated the binoculars to see distant objects more clearly.
